intro: Jamesbrittenia pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Jamesbrittenia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its bipinnately compound leaves, which are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Its showy, five-petaled flowers are typically pink or red, and they bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
